pullRequest.body:
For lemma isUnit_of_product_of_localizations :  Let `M` be a submonoid of a direct product of commutative rings `R' i`, and let `M' i` denote the projection of `M` onto each corresponding factor. Given a ring homomorphism from the direct product `∏ R' i` to the product of the localizations of each `R' i` at `M' i`, every `y : M` maps to a unit under this homomorphism.


For theorem injective_of_product_of_localizations : Let `M` be a submonoid of a direct product of commutative rings `R' i`, and let `M' i` denote the projection of `M` onto each factor. Then the canonical map from the localization of the direct product `∏ R' i` at `M` to the direct product of the localizations of each `R' i` at `M' i` is injective.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c4a4817c73](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19042/commits/c4a4817c73ebf59809e2a634987c41aa9b11b407)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Defs | 681 | 686 | +5 (+0.73%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Integer`|2|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Defs`|5|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ injective_of_product_of_localizations`
`+ isUnit_of_product_of_localizations`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I think your lemma and theorem still work if you consider a family of ring homs in place of the projections from a product ring (`Pi.evalRingHom`); for the theorem you need to assume the product of the ring homs [Pi.ringHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Pi.html#Pi.ringHom) is injective.
Also your results hold for CommSemiring in place of CommRing.

In fact I think it's true that a product of localizations is the localization of the product ring w.r.t. the product submonoid, even for infinite products. I proved something [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19714/files#diff-371857a0994c7c7a17b23d06dfc4075d201146f3d0f8810541c290db63b14d57R82-R87) for cylindrical submonoids instead of arbitrary products, which you might use as a reference.
Then you can factor your results into two parts: 1) that an injective ring hom induces an injective ring hom from the localization w.r.t. a submonoid to the localization w.r.t. the image submonoid, and 2) when the codomain of the ring hom is a product, then the localization is a product of localizations.
The name probably needs to be changed, but I'm not sure yet what to.

Do we even need to introduce `M'`? Would it be better to just write 
```
[isloc : ∀ i, IsLocalization (M.map (Pi.evalRingHom R' i)) (S' i)]
```
This line is pretty complicated. Could we break out the `by ... ` block into a preliminary `have`?

```suggestion
  exact funext fun i ↦ Ring.inverse_mul_cancel (f' i y) ((isloc i).map_units (S' i) ⟨y.1 i,
    by rw [h i]; exact Submonoid.mem_map_of_mem (Pi.evalRingHom R' i) y.2⟩)
```
or maybe
```suggestion
  exact funext fun i ↦ Ring.inverse_mul_cancel (f' i y) ((isloc i).map_units (S' i) ⟨y.1 i, ?_⟩)
  rw [h i]; exact Submonoid.mem_map_of_mem (Pi.evalRingHom R' i) y.2
```

```suggestion
  set f'' : R →+* P := Pi.ringHom f' 
```
?

Could you move these results to a new file, e.g. `Localization/Pi.lean`.

We shouldn't be adding new imports to `.Defs` files in order to add theorems!

```suggestion
  set f : S →+* P := sloc.lift (isUnit_of_product_of_localizations R' S' h)
```

```suggestion
  set R := ∀i, R' i
  set P := ∀i, S' i
```

I'd suggest
```suggestion
  set R := ∀ i, R' i
  set P := ∀ i, S' i
```
Some people like Andrew Yang prefers Π.
Here and below, all of your `set`s can just be `let`. (Better to use the more primitive language feature unless there is need for the extra behaviour of `set`.)

```suggestion
  choose m hm using fun i ↦ ((isloc i).mk'_eq_zero_iff ((sec M s).1 i)
    ⟨(sec M s).2.1 i, h₁ (sec M s).2 i⟩).mp (congrFun s₀ i)
```

```suggestion
    show _ * f'' _ _ = f'' (x.1) i
```
?

```suggestion
    (h : ∀ i, M' i = M.map (Pi.evalRingHom R' i)) :
```

```suggestion
  use fun i ↦ Ring.inverse (f' i y)
```

```suggestion
    IsUnit (Pi.ringHom fun i ↦ (algebraMap (R' i) (S' i)).comp (Pi.evalRingHom R' i) y) := by
```

This is a theorem, not a def, so:
```suggestion
theorem injective_of_product_of_localizations [Finite ι]
```
You should use [Fintype.ofFinite](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Fintype/Card.html#Fintype.ofFinite) to get Fintype and `classical` to get DecidableEq during the proof.

```suggestion
  set f' i : (∀ i, R' i) →+* S' i := (algebraMap (R' i) (S' i)).comp (Pi.evalRingHom R' i)
```
Lean doesn't like this, says expected :=. I tried adding (i: iota) to the variables, but the same issue arises.

You are only using `x` once so you can inline it. But I think you should just write
```suggestion
  use ⟨∏ j : ι, n j, M.prod_mem fun i _ ↦ (hn i).left⟩
```
or even omit the ` : ι`.

```suggestion
  refine funext fun i ↦ ?_
```
should work (untested)
Without the simp only, my rw breaks
Without the simp only, my rw breaks

```suggestion
  set f' i : R →+* S' i := (algebraMap (R' i) (S' i)).comp (Pi.evalRingHom R' i)
```
Same issue that I commented above

You can do
```suggestion
  refine funext fun i ↦ ?_
  simp_rw [Pi.mul_apply, Finset.prod_eq_mul_prod_diff_singleton (Finset.mem_univ i) n, Pi.mul_apply,
    mul_comm ((n i) i), mul_assoc, ← Pi.evalRingHom_apply R' i (n i), (hn i).right, hm i, mul_zero,
    Pi.zero_apply]
```
(I think it's fine to keep the `rfl`)

Doesn't work with `set` but actually works with `let` :)
```suggestion
    let f' i : (∀ i, R' i) →+* S' i := (algebraMap (R' i) (S' i)).comp (Pi.evalRingHom R' i)
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Localization/Defs): localization of a direct product injects into product of localizations
